runs.comm: steady length ball angled across from round the stumps, punched wide of mid off
flat and into the pads, worked behind square leg
too short, too flat, and going widish across, he rocks back and powers it past cover
straightens on middle and leg, worked past square leg's dive, there is a man in the deep
flat and staying a bit low outside off, punched to mid off

loud shout for caught behind from Kamran as Watson misses a sweep to one going across close to off, not given, Kamran has his glove up in question for quite some time, there was a deviation, but off the batsman's body
slanted in on a length to the pads, skids on and rolls behind square leg
angled across on a length, steered in typical Watson fashion to third man
shuffles across and outside off, punches a back of a length ball to the bowler
straightens from short of a length, on the stumps, he works it to midwicket
this one slants in now, fullish and again on the stumps, worked through square leg
pitched up, played back to the bowler
good length ball straightening into the left-hander, worked behind square leg
goes for the drive to a length ball outside off, thick inside edge onto pad and into the off side
that one angled in and skidded on from a length, some inswing as well, Watson hit high on the pad, Gul looks at the umpire but knows it was sliding down leg, pretty high too
this one holds its line now, tight length on off, superb start from Gul, Watson runs it to backward point

and Umar Gul is back and roaring for Pakistan in his first over, serving up ones that swing in and swing away, this one was angled in and fuller than the previous ones, swung in a tad as well, caught Watson on the pad again, and looks to be alright, have to wait for replays, hit in front of middle, below the knee rolls, most umpires will give them
fine drive first ball as Gul steams in, mid off fields and hits the stumps direct, Hussey has made it comfortably
swings away good length and widish outside off, left alone

and one more, Tanvir slows it up, curls it away appreciably again, fullish length has Hussey reaching out to that widish line, and extra cover accepts the dolly gleefully, Hussey was really feeling for that one way from the body, he was walking outside with momentum as he pushed
swings in down the leg side
pushed to mid off for one
pitched up, and Warner pushes right forward and drills it high over mid off
straightens around off, good length, Warner across to get behind the line and block
crunched through the covers, fuller length has Warner coming out to meet it again with a crisp followthrough that sends it racing past extra cover's dive
goes across to a good length ball and pushes towards mid off
beaten outside off, goes after a straightening length ball outside off, looking to steer to third man
back of a length, did not quite get hold of the pull as he swivelled and swung hard, gets it past midwicket's dive
Gul with the yorker, but Warner is able to jam it through midwicket for a couple
pushes firmly but straight to mid off
short of a length, into the pads, worked past midwicket
offbreak spinning in sharply, from outside off into the pads, worked to short fine
flat first up to Warner, straightening on middle, worked to midwicket
shuffles right across to an offspinner on middle and leg, forced to midwicket
and then this one rushes on with the angle from round the stumps, that was headed for middle and off, Warner got some bat on it late
defended off the front foot
angled in full, he gets slightly inside the line and drives down to wide long off
that was close, caught on the pads deep in the crease to one sliding in, that was headed just down the leg side, just
pushed hard to long off
flat and short of a length, he shuffles across and pulls hard down to deep midwicket
skids across outside off, slapped away through midwicket

angled across and worked wide of midwicket, second direct hit from Pakistan, Malik it is, but the batsman was already in the crease, almost past the stumps, and a couple of overthrows are conceded at the striker's end
twin appeals turned down, one for leg before, as Warner plays around one angled in full, then for a catch, as the ball pops up to off and is taken by point running in and diving
pushed through quick and flat outside off, cut to point
turning away from well outside off, paddled through square leg
he is firing it in at the moment, into the pads from wide of the crease, Warner misses the slog-sweep
flat and shortish again, width outside off, slapped back to the bowler
giving no air to the ball at all, windmillish quick-arm action, worked in front of square leg from outside off
another one quick and into the pads, worked square
worked through midwicket, they come back for two, third time Pakistan have hit the stumps direct tonight, and they take another run for the ricochet
shuffling outside off stump and worked in front of square leg

soft dismissal for Warner, leading edge pops up tamely to the bowler, closing the face a bit to try and work the fullish ball to leg, it straightens, Warner trying to check the push in the end, in vain, and Hafeez consumes one more left-hander
full on the pads, worked behind square leg
worked to deep midwicket
width outside off, cut past point, sweeper fields
slaps it down to long on from outside off

maiden international wicket for Raza Hasan, Hussey holing out to long on as he did in the third ODI, trying to clear the man, takes a step out and lofts it hard, fielder was in from the boundary and took it above his head
gives it some air now the young man, has him reaching out and pushing towards point
wide outside off as it spins away very sharply, huge turn, beaten on the cut
and this one is quick and flat and straight, beaten again outside off, showcasing some variety now, the spinner
angled across outside off, slapped straight to point
hello, they continue to fall, and Pakistan are catching them all, Bailey goes down for the slog-sweep to a full delivery, and finds deep square leg, who leaps and takes it high, and safely
worked softly in the air past midwicket
bat in front of pad to defend down the pitch
Wade decides to sweep now, this one came in with the angle and he ended up squeezing it perilously close to leg stump
tossed up full, eased to extra cover
some spin there in this pitch, runs it to point with an open face
there again, turns away from the attempted slog sweep from outside off, beaten
wow, that is sharper turn, bowled slower, that has pitched leg and middle, and zipped across outside off, past the outside edge, taken some thigh pad through vacant slip
full into the pads from round the stumps and worked past short fine leg
wary of that turn, pushes forward outside the original line, it straightens alright and is blocked to off
tight line on off, defended
goes for the sweep, hit on the pad, but the appeal is turned down, as it hit him outside the line of off
tries to make room, but it skids in sharply, into middle and leg, and he has to stab it away off the back foot
the doosra now, turns away a bit, he runs it behind point
offbreak pops up in the air, Kamran takes it some paces towards square leg, off the pad flap though
misses the sweep to an offspinner going down leg
one more doosra, he pushes out, and gets a thick edge towards point
that turned in quickly, he was caught in the crease, thick inside edge to short fine leg
gives it some air, he skips out, but gets too close to the pitch, and hits it to long on
bowled short and flat into the left-hander, he opens up for the pull, too much pace on the ball, and has to push it to long on
slower now, fuller, he runs it to short third
speared in from wide of the crease, turns down leg
shuffles across and nudges to short fine leg
top-edge of a flat slog-sweep, on the bounce to deep square leg
shortish and flat, outside off, missed out there, slapped it straight to extra cover
standing outside leg stump, it arrives slow and full on the stumps, nudged to midwicket
shortish, but the doosra, misdirected pull down to long on
makes a lot of room, Ajmal ensures he is left with none as he fires it in, guided to point
not sure which way it is going, it is the offspinner, he goes across and runs it to short third
down the track, it is pushed through flat, and pops up in the air off pad as he tries to push it away
stands miles outside leg, he spears it in, can only push it towards covers
slog-sweep, from outside off, sails high in the air, and sails down to deep midwicket
straightens outside off, guided through point
beaten by the turn, quick, angled in from wide of the crease, he tries to defend, beaten
pushed to point for a single
hit on the thigh pad with a pacy back of a length ball
back of a length again, runs it to point
opens up and gives the pull everything, drags it just wide of midwicket, long on slides across and throws it back quickly
down the track and swats a length ball to mid off
can't do much with a length ball right on off, shuffles across and works it down to long on
goes for the yorker, into the pads, he misses the flick and the ball rolls towards point
Maxwell falls too, now, he had looked very comfortable against Ajmal in the third ODI, has to go for it now, slog-sweeps hard, but only hits it high in the air to deep square leg
this is a demolition really now, skiddy offspinner from round the stumps, White playing from the crease, it hurries on from middle, brushes pad and strikes the stumps
plays out the hat trick ball with a forward push, and it pops up towards vacant short leg
another sweep, from outside off, down to deep square leg, who fumbles and allows one more
turn, lots of it, Doherty pushing miles inside the line as he hopped across to defend
slides on this time, he was hopping across again, adjusted to work to square leg
Pakistan missing the direct hit when the chance was really there, non-striker had no chance of completing the run, but the throw from backward point missed
low full toss swinging into the pads, rolls to leg
pitched full on the stumps, squeezed back down the track, Gul stops it to his right
gloves the pull off a short ball wide of fine leg as he swivels and overbalances across
makes room and comes down the pitch, Gul swings it in late and full, past the bat, just past leg stump
full toss moving in, swatted away to sweeper cover
wide ball back of a length from round the stumps, swung straight to long on
they miss the direct hit again, from mid off this time

sharp, sharp take from Kamran, give the man some credit for this, I say, Tanvir spearing it in full from wide of the crease, and round the stumps, Kamran is moving down the leg side alright, but there is a huge deflection off a thick inside edge, the ball is dying at Kamran's left foot, but he gets the gloves down in time, and pouches it as he tumbles down
